name: Scraping The Sky Online Trivia | World Sites | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

	The towers are the headquarters of the state-owned Petroliam Nasional Berhad (Petronas).

questions.text: What is the name of the Petronas Towers' architect?
questions.explanation:
Cesar Antonio Pelli.

	Cesar Pelli and associates of New Haven, Connecticut.

questions.text: What is the height of the Petronas Towers, from ground level?
questions.explanation:
451.9 metres

	Beating the Sears Tower, Chicago, which stands at 443 metres.

questions.text: What is the term given to the structure that links the Petronas Towers?
questions.explanation:
Sky-bridge.

	The sky-bridge is located on levels 41 and 42 of the towers, at a height of 170 metres from street level.

questions.text: When did the Petronas Towers earn the title of 'tallest office buildings in the world'?
questions.explanation:
1996.

	The Petronas Towers surpassed the Sears Tower in 1996, although the buildings were not opened until 1997.

questions.text: What activity took place at the Petronas Towers on August 29, 2001?
questions.explanation:
Base-jumping World Tournament.

	More than forty extreme sport divers jumped from the 73rd floor of the building and parachuted down to the ground. Most made it safely.

questions.text: How many floors do each of the twin Petronas towers have?
questions.explanation:
88.

	Although they are the tallest buildings in the world, they actually have fewer floors than the Sears Tower and than did the twin towers of the World Trade Center.

questions.text: What is the name of the Malaysian Prime Minister that inaugurated the Petronas Towers?
options: Tunku Abdul Rahman Putra Al Haj
Tun Abdul Razak bin Dato Hussien
questions.explanation:
Mahathir Mohamad.

	All three 'wrong choices are past Malaysian prime ministers.

questions.text: How many double-deck high speed passenger lifts are there in the Petronas Towers?
What were the architects asked to define in the original plans for the Kuala Lumpur city centre development?
questions.explanation:
A gateway.

	A place between East and West, that people can identify as unique to the city and Malaysia.
